column4: any linux professionals here? my girlfriend is doing her masters degree with a linguistical linux application called FrameNet (developed by the University of Berkely) which is extremely limited, but sill open source; the problem is, that the woman, who is not a linux expert but a linguist, has to come all the way from Germany to install this application on a clean Ubuntu hardy, but she wants 2000 euros for the job; now i've looked through the list an
wants 2000 euros to do what with the app?
the app itself is a language database
so, you want to know how to install it?
no i want an evaluation of the costs :D
which inclusdes installing apps that are in the ubuntu repos and compiling framenet
imho, wi wouldn't give the woman more than 500 eur :P
what do you mean an evaluation of the costs? someone coming 'all the way from Germany' isn't charging much for that
well.....for those things....like 150 eur for adding a user to the mysql database...
plus, it doesn't look like FrameNet is free, at all
anyway, if you got 10 min i could send you the xls to your email or something
limited in which way? data, or functionality?
people - you have to ask the devel to get a license, but it's free
so if you have the license, why do you still need to pay? can't you install it all yourself?
it's complicated.... wait until you see my email
